page.title: 08PENSIONER INTERVIEW
page.content: MRS BRACKLEY HAS LIVED AT BUCKLAND COMMON FOR 31 YEARS.SHE HAS A CAR WHICH IS VERY IMPORTANT AS THEY LIVE OUT IN THE COUNTRY.THE SURROUNDING COUNTRY IS RELATIVELY UNTOUCHED AND VERY PRETTY.TRAFFIC HAS INCREASED AND SEVERAL SMALL BUSINESSES HAVE STARTED UP.THERE HASN'T BEEN ANY MAIN CHANGES. THE CARS DON'T MAKE MUCH NOISE AEROPLANES MAKEMOST OF IT.THE MAIN CROP IS BARLEY AND A BIT OF WHEAT.THERE IS NO VANDALISM.THEY HAVE NO GAS AS THERE ARE NO GAS MAINS IN THE AREA.THERE IS VERY LITTLE HOUSING DEVELOPEMENT AS THE AREA IS "GREEN BELT".THERE ARE LOTS OF FARMS,A VILLAGE HALL,PLAYING FIELDS, A CHAPEL, A 17th CENTURY CHURCH AND SEVERAL PUBS.SHE LIKES THE PEACE OF THE COUNTRY BUT MISSES THE SHOPS AND FRIENDS IN TOWN.THERE IS A GOOD BUS SERVICE.
